noAdminMessage: This account doesn't have any admin
noUserMessage: This account doesn't have any regular user

chargeReminder.line1: Your on-file credit card will immediately be charged for any changes you make. If you have changed any recurring services, new charges will be pro-rated for your billing cycle.
chargeReminder.line2: Are you sure you want to continue?

unknown.name: Other than above
unknown.help: Please select this option when you want this account to place calls to ANY NUMBER other than mentioned on the list. (When the format of the number is unknown to the system.)

trunksLegend: Set limits for included simultaneous inbound and outbound calls
callRestrictionsTitle: This account can place calls to...
balanceTooltip: This credit will be used to make per-minute (plan) calls, international calls and receive toll-free calls.
allowPrepay: Allow customers to make per-minute calls that go over the above limit, and bill them the per-minute cost of the call

addAdminLink.toggleOn: Add an admin to the account
addAdminLink.toggleOff: I changed my mind, who needs an admin?

adminLabels.emailTooltip: This email address will serve as the user name to log-in to Monster-UI.

adminLabels.sendCredentialsEmail: Send an email to this admin with a reminder of these credentials
adminLabels.sendCredentialsEmailShort: Send a summary email with credentials

wizardProcessingMessage2: Please wait while the account is being created.

autogenPasswordPopup.message: A password has ben auto-generated for your administrator {{adminName}}. This is the only time this password will be displayed, you should memorize it or write it down.

toastrMessages.limitsUpdateError: An unexpected error occured when updating the limits, please try again later.

toastrMessages.creditAddError: An unexpected error occured when adding credit, please try again later.

newAccount.noMatchCallflowError: An error occurred while setting up the default callflow for the account.
newAccount.planError: An error occured while setting up the service plan.

uiRestrictionsLegend: Select what your customer can view
uiRestrictionsTooltip: When you click on your name from top right corner of the screen, you will see a dropdown menu. To restrict the view of options for this Account simply uncheck.

deleteAccountDialog.title: Confirmation of Account Deletion
deleteAccountDialog.deleteMessageIntro: This action CANNOT be undone. This will permanently delete the "{{variable}}" account, release all phone numbers, deactivate any mobile devices and remove any provisioning files.
deleteAccountDialog.deleteMessageExplanation: Please type the word "{{variable}}" in the following input and then click on the Delete Account button to proceed.

__comment: UI-1609: Add a way to Remove Credit

updateCreditDialog.title: Update Credits Amount
updateCreditDialog.helpAddCreditOne: By using this, you will add some credits to the balance of this account, which will allow it enable features such as e911 or Caller-ID, but also to place per-minute calls.
updateCreditDialog.helpRemoveCreditOne: We let you remove credits from your sub-accounts with this feature. If you added too many credits to an account, you could fix it by removing the extra credits here for example.
updateCreditDialog.successfulUpdate: Congratulations, you successfuly updated the amount of credits available on that account! :)

account_has_descendants: You need to delete subaccounts before deleting this account

promoteDemoteError: An error happened during this operation. Please try again later.

promoteAccount.confirm: You are about to promote this account

demoteAccount.confirm: You are about to demote this account

labels.cascadeTooltip: Pricing and Discount Tiers are based on the total number of items across all sub-accounts

generalSettings.label: General Settings
generalSettings.description: Base account settings and administrator information.
generalSettings.title: General Account & Administrator Information

help.accountName: The name of the account should be unique system-wide.
help.accountRealm: A custom account realm can be set. However, it will be auto-generated if left empty.
help.whitelabeledAccountRealm: The account realm has been auto-generated. However it can be edited if required, but must not be left empty.

accountAdmins.title: Account Administrators
accountAdmins.description: You have the option to create administrators under this new account during this step. For each administrator added below,  a corresponding user will be created in SmartPBX. You can add as many administrators as your situation requires.

labels.sendMail: Send notifcation and welcome emails to this user upon account creation?

accountContacts.label: Account Contacts
accountContacts.description: Provide technical and billing contacts to this new account.
accountContacts.title: Add important contact information pertaining to this account

servicePlan.label: Service Plan
servicePlan.description: Select applicable Service Plan(s) to assign to this new account.
servicePlan.title: Select one or more Service Plans to apply to this new account

usageAndCallRestrictions.label: Usage + Call Restrictions
usageAndCallRestrictions.description: Assign trunk limits and call restrictions to this new account.
usageAndCallRestrictions.title: Configure trunking limits and set call restrictions

labels.allowPerMinuteCalls: Allow customers to make per-minute calls

help.inbound: The number of Inbound trunks defines how many simultaneous calls you can receive to your phone system.
help.outbound: The number of Outbound trunks defines how many concurrent external calls you can place at one time.
help.twoway: The number of Two-way trunks defines how many concurrent calls your platform can handle at one time.

callRestrictions.title: Call Restrictions
callRestrictions.description: By default, all available calling capabilities are enabled for new accounts. If you wish to place call restrictions on this new account, simply turn off the calling capability to restrict this account from placing that type of call.

help.tollfree_us: Allows calls to US TollFree numbers.
help.toll_us: Allows calls to US Toll numbers.
help.emergency: Allows calls to Emergency Dispatch numbers.
help.did_us: Allows calls to US DID numbers.
help.unknown: Allows calls to all other numbers.

creditBalanceAndFeatures.label: Credit Balance + Features
creditBalanceAndFeatures.description: Add credit, and select which functionality this new account has access to in Control Center.
creditBalanceAndFeatures.title: Set initial account credit balance and configure control center access

help.initialBalance: Adding credits manually allows you to immediately set your initial Current Balance. Maintaining a Current Balance is very important, as it is necessary for international or per-minute calls, e911, caller ID, and other system features that incur a charge.

controlCenterAccess.title: Control Center Access
controlCenterAccess.help: The Control Center is a module that allows you to manage general features of your account.
controlCenterAccess.description: You are able to restrict which Control Center features are accessible to this new account. Select the desired features, or leave them all available depending on your business use case and this account's needs.

help.account: Allow users to view/change account name, account realm, technical contact and account timezone/language preferences.
help.balance: Allow users to view the "Per Minute" tab of Usage Charges.
help.billing: Allow users to view/change the card on file and billing contact.
help.credit: Allow users to view the "Credit Info" tab in their Control Center.
help.errorTracker: Allow users to view list of UI Error Logs and send error reports.
help.inbound: Allow users to configure inbound trunking limits.
help.minutes: Allow users to view the "Minutes Info" tab in their Control Center.
help.outbound: Allow users to configure outbound trunking limits.
help.service_plan: Allow users to view/download a copy of the Service Plan applied to the account.
help.transactions: Allow users to view the Transactions log.
help.twoway: Allow users to configure two way trunking limits.
help.user: Allow users to view/change their passwords, timezone & language preferences, date/time display, colorblind mode, and more.

appRestrictions.label: Application Restrictions
appRestrictions.description: Decide which applications, if any, should be restricted on this new account.
appRestrictions.title: Which applications should this new account have access to?

accessLevel.description: By default, new accounts have access to ALL available applications on the App Exchange. If you wish to customize application access for this new account, you can choose ‘Restricted Access’ below. This will BLOCK ACCESS TO ALL APPLICATIONS, requiring you to manually whitelist the applications you want this account to have access to.
accessLevel.help: Restricted Access will BLOCK ACCESS TO ALL APPLICATIONS, requiring you to manually whitelist the applications you want this account to have access to.
accessLevel.notice: This step merely sets the access restrictions for applications on this new account. It DOES NOT enable the applications on the account itself. To enable applications, you or another account administrator will need to do so within this new account’s App Exchange.

apps.title: Restrict Access to the Following Applications
apps.description: This account will not be able to access any applications until you manually list which applications this account should have access to.

review.label: Review + Confirm
review.description: Review account configurations before finalizing the creation of your new account.
review.title: Please review and confirm the configurations for your new account

types.restricted: Access restricted to the following apps

info.noAccountData: No account contacts have been added to this new account.
